text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- President Hosni Mubarak will announce in January the government's plans to develop southern Egypt. The project includes setting up 25 industrial zones. Prime Minister Kamal Ganzouri meets with the ministerial committee to develop the area. Government to partly fund the projects from the current budget.
- Widespread Arab reaction to Mubarak's warnings on Israel's antagonistic policies.
- Egyptian Foreign Minister Amr Moussa informs Palestinian President Yasser Arafat about the visit of Israeli envoy Dore Gold to Egypt.
- Palestinian negotiators Saeb Erekat says Egypt is actual sponsor of the peace process
- Fire guts fuel depot in Alexandria.
- Mubarak announces that a new civilisation will arise on the outskirts of the Nile valley by January.
- Antiquities officials retrieve two rare Coptic icons before they were smuggled out of the country.
- Government officials to allows 50,000 tonnes of sugar on market before the fasting month of Ramadan.
- Israel has intensified its rabid attacks on Egypt's regional role.
